definition: (of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu

sentences.english: A plot was uncovered against the President.
sentences.chinese: 谋害总统的阴谋败露了。

sentences.english: The kidnapper is yulia tutor, see his jump off a building suicide.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪是尤丽亚的家教老师，见事情败露便跳楼自尽。

sentences.english: Most who unveil hisagendas deserve the condemnation they receive。
sentences.chinese: 大多数人，秘密计划败露了，得到应有的谴责。

sentences.english: His plot has been struck out.
People guessed, people knew, and eventually it was only a matter of time before it all had to come out.
sentences.chinese: 人们的猜疑，窥探，到最后事情最终被败露。

sentences.english: Most who unveil hisagendas deserve the condemnation they receive.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人，秘密计划败露了，应谴责。

sentences.english: What do by night appear by day.
sentences.chinese: 夜间干的事，白天会败露。

sentences.english: Suppose you were exposed in the opposite position by your opponent, .
sentences.chinese: 假设你被敌手败露在相背的位置，。

sentences.english: Brought to light the inner distress still not calm, can not mature sophistication.
sentences.chinese: 遇事还是会败露内心的不平静，做不到成熟老辣。

sentences.english: The conspiracy did not come to light until a newspaper reporter noticed.
sentences.chinese: 直到报社的记者发现，这个阴谋才败露出来。

sentences.english: At last Alberta Fujimore knew that the game was up, and let him be taken by the police.
sentences.chinese: 最后藤森知道罪行已败露，让警察把他带走了。

definition: (of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
lit. paper can't wrap fire; fig. the truth will out
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to lodge an accusation/accusation (law)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to expose/to uncover
to uncover
conspiracy/secret plan/to conspire
the whole truth is revealed (idiom); everything becomes clear
to dread punishment/afraid of being arrested for a crime
to commit suicide to escape punishment
to penetrate/to see through
to confess
to divulge secrets
